isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - MAINTENANCE

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Step numbers correspond to numbers in Figure 1.

step1.para: Air System and Connections. Check for leaks, worn air lines, loose connections and bolts. Refer to AIR SYSTEM.
Clutch Housing Mounting. Check clutch housing bolts for looseness.

Clutch Release Bearing. Remove hand hole cover and check the radial and axial clearance of the release bearing. Check relative position of thrust surface of release bearing with thrust sleeve on push-type clutches.
Clutch Pedal Shaft and Bores. Pry upward on shafts to check wear. If excessive movement is found, remove the clutch release mechanism and check bushings in bores and wear on shafts.
Lubricant. Change at specified service intervals. Use only the types and grades as recommended in GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Fill and Drain Plugs. Remove fill plugs and check level of lubricant at specified intervals. Tighten fill and drain plugs securely.
Gear Shift Lever. Check for looseness and free play in housing. If lever is loose in housing, proceed to Step 8.

Gear Shift Lever Housing Assembly. Remove the air lines at the air valve and remove the gear shift lever housing assembly from the transmission. Check tension spring and washer for set and wear. Check the gear shift lever pivot pin and pivot pin slot for wear. Check bottom end of gear shift lever for wear, and check slot of yokes and blocks in the shifter housing for wear at contact points with shift lever.
Universal Joint Companion Flange or Yoke Nut (Not Shown). Check for tightness. Tighten to recommended torque. Refer to the TORQUE CHART. .

note.para: If necessary, use solvent and shop rag to clean sealing surface of companion flange or yoke. DO NOT USE CROCUS CLOTH, EMERY PAPER OR OTHER ABRASIVE MATERIALS THAT WILL MAR SURFACE FINISH.

step1.para: Splines on Output Shaft. Check for wear from movement and chucking action of the universal joint companion flange or yoke.
Mainshaft Rear Bearing Cover. Check oil seal for wear.
Output Shaft. Pry upward against the output shaft to check radial clearance in the mainshaft rear bearing.
